content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: DSSTDTC
      operator: non_empty
    - name: DSSTDTC
      operator: contains
      value: /
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.317
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when the value of DSSTDTC is not a valid ISO 8601 date/time.
  This automatically excludes composite date/time-s
Outcome:
  Message: The value of DSSTDTC is not a valid ISO 8601 date/time
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '317'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The use of an interval of uncertainty, as described
                  in Section 4.4.2, cannot be used for DSSTDTC.
                Document: IG v3.1
                Section: 6.2.1.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - DS

json.Description: Raise an error when the value of DSSTDTC is not a valid ISO 8601 date/time. This automatically excludes composite date/time-s

Outcome.Message: The value of DSSTDTC is not a valid ISO 8601 date/time

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The use of an interval of uncertainty, as described in Section 4.4.2, cannot be used for DSSTDTC.
